math.doubleV

Class Vec3d<T extends Vec3d<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • math.doubleV.Vec3d<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanLoad, Vecd<T>, math.Vec<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SGVec_3d

    public abstract class Vec3d<T extends Vec3d<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Vecd<T>, CanLoad

      • magSq

        public double magSq()
        Description copied from interface: Vecd
        This method is faster than Vecd.mag() because it avoids calculating a square root. It is useful for comparisons, but not for getting exact lengths, as the return value is the square of the actual length.
        Specified by:
        magSq in interface Vecd<T extends Vec3d<T>>
        Returns:
        The squared euclidean length

        public double distSq(Vec3d point)
        Description copied from interface: Vecd
        This method is faster than Vecd.dist(Vecd) because it avoids calculating a square root. It is useful for comparisons, but not for getting accurate distances, as the return value is the square of the actual distance.

      • lerp

        public T lerp(Vec3d target,
              double alpha)
        Description copied from interface: Vecd
        Linearly interpolates between this vector and the target vector by alpha which is in the range [0,1]. The result is stored in this vector.
        Specified by:
        lerp in interface Vecd<T extends Vec3d<T>>
        Parameters:

      • slerp

        public Vec3d slerp(Vec3d target,
                   double alpha)
        Spherically interpolates between this vector and the target vector by alpha which is in the range [0,1]. The result is stored in this vector.
        Parameters:
        target - The target vector
        alpha - The interpolation coefficient
